title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 59-1.2 - Purpose and intent of rule
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 59-1.2 - Purpose and intent of rule

State Regulations

This rule is intended to set forth the responsibilities
of employers and workplace safety and loss prevention consultants participating
in the Workplace Safety and Loss Prevention Program. The Workplace Safety and

Loss Prevention Program is intended to reduce workplace injuries and result in
lower workers' compensation costs for employers. Furthermore, it is the purpose
and intent of this rule to establish procedures which must be followed by
individuals seeking departmental certification as a workplace safety and loss
prevention consultant. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
59-1.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
